title.narrative: CHILD PROTECTION

description.narrative: Local authorities in target areas have adopted child-friendly strategies, improved knowledge of the situation of children and enhanced capacity to design and deliver integrated and equitable supply of services., which contributes to Child Protection And Emergencies, Child Protection Systems, Communication And Advocacy, Cross-Sectoral - Human Rights, Cross-Sectoral - Other Programme Areas, Data And Child Protection, Evaluation, Human Rights Institutions, Justice For Children, Promotion Of Care, Mental Health And Psychosocial Well-Being And Justice, Protection From Violence, Exploitation, Abuse And Neglect, Protection From Violence, Exploitation, Abuse And Neglect (Covid), Research, Violence, Exploitation And Abuse. UNICEF aims to achieve this through Advocacy And Communications, Advocacy And Public Engagement, Data, Research, Evaluation And Knowledge Management, Evaluations, Research And Data, Operational Support To Programme Delivery, Systems Strengthening And Institution Building, Systems Strengthening To Leave No One Behind. This contributes to the following Country Programme result: By 2021, child-related national policies, budgets and systems, including the child protection system, are inclusive and equity- focused.

condition.narrative: Should contribute directly to results for children as outlined in the UNDAF, national results and/or UNICEF Strategic Plan and within the scope defined in the CPD, CPAP, OMP or other agreed upon programme documents

title.narrative: Local authorities in target areas have adopted child-friendly strategies, improved knowledge of the situation of children andenhanced capacity to design and deliver integrated and equitable supply of services.

description.narrative: UNICEF continued its support to the Government and other stakeholders in strengthening the child protection system and in ending violence against children at home, in the schools and online. Important standards and guidance documents were approved for;social service workforce strengthening and for CPiE.; The Committee for Standardization of social services led by the MLSP and the National Standardization and Measurement Agency endorsed the Standards for provision of Social Work services and the CPiE Standards. The Child Helpline was upgraded responding to 50,991 calls related to violations of child rights providing case management services for 7,428 children needing protection.; | Status:On-track | As-of Date:28/12/2021
